@Bl3nd wrote:

Try putting the last method into the if (c.specAmount < 10.0) {…method I’m just making a guess but if you want to apply that non-donator method into the code, maybe try after the c.sendMessage("blah"); if not try before the else. If nothing…I don’t know.

item.title: PI donator only can do this problem (normal can use too)
item.dc:creator: @shank_beast shank beast
item.description:
@shank_beast wrote:

Here’s my shit.

if(c.specAmount < 10.0){ if (c.specRestore > 0 && c.playerRights == 4) return; //c.specRestore = 120; c.specAmount = 10.0; c.forcedChat("Ahh, my spec was restored less then 1 second..."); c.startAnimation(8996); c.getItems().addSpecialBar(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]); // c.sendMessage("Your special attack has been restored, only every 120 seconds."); } else { c.sendMessage("You spec is not empty"); 
				}
				if (c.specRestore > 0 && c.playerRights == 0) {
					c.sendMessage("You need to be a donator, that sucks.. you have to wait..");
				}
				
				break;</blockquote>

It still let’s player rights 0 use it…can anyone fix this?
